hal::Pwm Class Reference

Documentation

This class implements PWM outputs.

Here is an example of how to use the Pwm class

#include <sapi/hal.hpp>
Pwm pwm(1); //use PWM port 1
PwmPinAssignment pin_assignment;
pin_assignment->channel[0] = mcu_pin(1,20); //Use Pin 1.20
pwm.init(Pwm::FLAG_SET_TIMER | Pwm::FLAG_IS_ENABLED, 24000000, 1000, pin_assignment);
pwm.set_channel(2, 500);

Member Function Documentation

int hal::Pwm::disable ( ) const
inline

Disables the PWM timer.

See also
enable()
int hal::Pwm::enable ( ) const
inline

Enables the PWM timer.

Returns
Zero on success

This method can be used with disable() to start and stop the PWM timer while preserving the attributes.

int hal::Pwm::get_channel ( u32  loc)
inline

Gets the channel value.

Parameters
locChannel location
Returns
The value of the channel or (u32)-1 for an error
int hal::Pwm::init ( u32  o_flags,
u32  freq,
u32  period,
const pwm_pin_assignment_t *  pin_assignment = 0 
)
inline

Opens the PWM and sets the attributes.

This method takes the same arguments as set_attr().

int hal::Pwm::set_attr ( u32  o_flags,
u32  freq,
u32  period,
const pwm_pin_assignment_t *  pin_assignment = 0 
) const
inline

Sets the PWM attributes.

Parameters
o_flagsPWM flags to apply (for example, FLAG_SET_TIMER)
freqThe PWM timer frequency
periodThe PWM timer period
pin_assignmentA pointer to the pin assignment (leave blank to use BSP pin assignment)
Returns
Zero on success or less than zero for an error

) const

Parameters

inline

Sets the channel using the channel reference.

Parameters
channelThe channel location and value
Returns
Zero on success
int hal::Pwm::set_channels ( const pwm_pin_assignment_t *  pin_assignment)
inline

Sets the channel configuration.

Parameters
pin_assignmentA pointer to the pin assignment
Returns
Zero on success

This method is equivalent to set_attr() with o_flags set to PWM::FLAG_SET_CHANNELS.
